info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued April 14 at 3:06AM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: .DISCUSSION...Strong northwest winds will persist across much of the area through this afternoon before gradually decreasing into the evening. These winds will contribute to blowing snow across portions of northwestern SD. Over southwestern and south central SD, where little to no snow fell, high to extreme fire danger is expected as a result of these winds and minimum relative humidity values of 20 to 30 percent. Winds will become breezy again over portions of the western SD plains tomorrow afternoon. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... The grassland fire danger index will reach the extreme category this afternoon. Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. No outdoor burning should take place. The outlook for Friday afternoon, The grassland fire danger index will reach the high category.
